# PTD Today Forward Watchlist (Rest of Year • Headline Signals Last 30 Days)

## 1) Themes to Watch
- Offshore wind project regulatory and permitting challenges in the US (Orsted halted $5B project).
- Accelerating solar deployments and record CfD tenders (UK, Bangladesh, Nepal, US market growth).
- Increasing focus on domestic content requirements in renewable energy storage (India mandates 20% local content).
- Semiconductor industry dynamics amid fab expansions and pricing pressures (Intel Arizona fab, China wafer price trends).
- Emerging applications of AI and digital twins in renewables and data center operations.
- Infrastructure security risks highlighted by subsea cable sabotage allegations (Finnish police detain Russian crew).

## 2) What to Monitor Next

### Grid / Renewables
- Offshore wind policy and project approvals in the US; impact of Orsted’s stalled $5B offshore wind project.
- Solar project pipelines and auction trends: UK solar CfD records, Bangladesh 220 MW projects, rural solar monitoring in Nepal, and US solar capacity scaling to 737.8 GW by 2035.
- Utility grid regulations for flexible connections supporting community solar (US states enforcing new rules).

### Oil & Gas
- No direct signals in the current feed.

### Data Centers & AI
- AI-driven "inference economics" and digital twin technologies for floating PV applications.
- Security of critical subsea infrastructure affecting data centers (seizure of ship for alleged subsea cable damage).

### Semiconductors
- Intel’s Arizona fab operational status and strategic importance.
- China wafer pricing trends suggesting module price shifts near CNY 1/W in 2026.

### Critical Minerals / Rare Earths
- India’s mandate for minimum 20% domestic content in battery storage signals supply chain localization efforts.

## 3) Regions / Companies Appearing Repeatedly
- China (solar manufacturing, wafer pricing, offshore wind capacity).
- US (solar market growth, offshore wind projects, flexible grid connections).
- UK (record solar CfD deployments).
- India (domestic content mandate for batteries, large PV manufacturer Waaree Energies).
- Orsted (offshore wind project challenge in US).
- Intel (semiconductor fab in Arizona).

## 4) Constraints / Risks Implied by Headlines
- Regulatory/permitting delays impacting large offshore wind projects (Orsted’s US halt).
- Potential project exits or supply chain disruptions in China solar manufacturing (Eging PV project uncertainty).
- Rising pricing pressure and market volatility for solar wafers/modules (China wafer leaders raising quotes).
- Infrastructure security and geopolitical risks affecting subsea cables (Finnish seizure of ship, Russian crew detained).
- Utilities shifting to fixed charges may deter efficiency investments and community solar adoption.

---

This watchlist highlights critical developments in renewables scale-up, semiconductor supply chain evolution, AI adoption in energy asset management, and emerging geopolitical risks to infrastructure impacting transmission and data centers.
